info.title: Azure Media Services
info.description: This Swagger was generated by the API Framework.

Preset.description: Base type for all Presets, which define the recipe or instructions on how the input media files should be processed.

label.description: Describes the optional label for the codec.

Codec.description: Describes the basic properties of all codecs.

channels.description: Gets or sets number of channels in the Audio.

samplingRate.description: Gets or sets the sampling rate to use for encoding.

bitrate.description: Gets or sets the bitrate of the encoded audio.

Audio.description: Defines the common properties for all audio codecs.

values.description: Specifies that the output audio is to be encoded into AAC-LC or AAC Low Complexity profile.
Specifies that the output audio is to be encoded into HE-AAC v1 profile.
Specifies that the output audio is to be encoded into HE-AAC v2 profile.

profile.description: Gets or sets the encoding profile to be used when encoding audio with AAC.

AacAudio.description: Describes Advanced Audio Codec or AAC audio encoding settings.

audioLanguage.description: Specifies the language for the audio payload in the input. Typically in the format of "language code-country/region" (e.g: "en-US").

AudioAnalyzerPreset.description: The Audio Analyzer preset applies a pre-defined set of AI-based analysis operations, including speech transcription, on the input.

inputLabel.description: Gets or sets the label of the Input which is to be used as an Overlay. The Input must specify exactly one file.

inputLoop.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the overlay media is looped to match the duration of the input video. The default is true. For example, you may have a 5 second animation that needs to be overlaid onto an hour-long video - you would set inputLoop to true in this case.

start.description: Gets or sets the start position, with reference to the input video, at which the overlay starts. The value should be in ISO 8601 format. The default is zero, which means the overlay starts from the beginning of the input video.

end.description: Gets or sets the position in the input video at which the overlay ends. The value should be in ISO 8601 format. The default behavior is that overlay will be applied until the end of the input video if InputLoop is true. Else, if inputLoop is false, then overlay will last as long as the duration of the overlay media.

fadeInDuration.description: Gets or sets the duration over which the overlay fades in onto the input video. The value should be in ISO 8601 format. The default is to have no fade in

fadeOutDuration.description: Gets or sets the duration over which the overlay fades out of the input video. The value should be in ISO 8601 format. The default is to have no fade out."

audioGainLevel.description: Gets or sets the gain level of audio in the overlay. The value should be in the range [0, ..., 1.0]. Defaults to a value of 1.0.

Overlay.description: Base type for all overlays - image, audio or video.

AudioOverlay.description: Describes the properties of an audio overlay.

CopyVideo.description: A special codec flag, which tells the encoder to simply copy the input video bitstream.

keyFrameInterval.description: Describes the distance between one key frame and the next, thereby defining a GOP or group of pictures. The value should be a non-zero integer in the range [1, .., 30], specified in ISO 8601 format. The default is 2 seconds.

values.description: Strictly respect the output resolution without considering the pixel aspect ratio or display aspect ratio of the input video.

Override the output resolution, and change it to match the display aspect ratio of the input, without padding. For example, if the input is 1920x1080 and the encoding preset asks for 1280x1280, then the value in the preset is overridden, and the output will be at 1280x720, which maintains the input aspect ratio of 16:9.

Pad the output (with either letterbox or pillar box) to honor the output resolution, while ensuring that the active video region in the output has the same aspect ratio as the input. For example, if the input is 1920x1080 and the encoding preset asks for 1280x1280, then the output will be at 1280x1280, which contains an inner rectangle of 1280x720 at aspect ratio of 16:9, and pillar box regions 280 pixels wide at the left and right.

stretchMode.description: Describes the resizing mode - how the input video will be resized to fit the desired output resolution(s). Default is AutoSize

Video.description: Describes the basic properties for encoding a video.

start.description: Describes the position in the input video from where to start generating thumbnails. The value can be in absolute timestamp (ISO 8601, e.g: PT05S), or a frame count (e.g: 10 for the 10th frame), or a relative value (e.g: 1%). Also supports a special value {Best}, which tells the encoder to select the best thumbnail from the first few seconds of the video.

step.description: Describes the intervals at which thumbnails are generated. The value can be in absolute timestamp (ISO 8601, e.g: PT05S for one image every 5 seconds), or a frame count (e.g: 30 for every 30 frames), or a relative value (e.g: 1%).

range.description: Describes the position in the input video at which to stop generating thumbnails. The value can be in absolute timestamp (ISO 8601, e.g: PT5M30S to stop at 5 minutes and 30 seconds), or a frame count (e.g: 300 to stop at the 300th frame), or a relative value (e.g: 100%).

Image.description: Describes the basic properties for generating thumbnails from the input video

filenamePattern.description: Describes the pattern of the file names for the generated output files. The following macros are supported in the file name: {Basename} - The base name of the input video {Extension} - The appropriate extension for this format. {Label} - The label assigned to the codec/layer. {Index} - A unique index for thumbnails. Only applicable to thumbnails. {Bitrate} - The audio/video bitrate. Not applicable to thumbnails. {Codec} - The type of the audio/video codec. Any unsubstituted macros will be collapsed and removed from the filename.

ImageFormat.description: Describes the properties for an output image file.

JpgFormat.description: Describes the settings for producing JPEG thumbnails.

PngFormat.description: Describes the settings to produce PNG thumbnail output.

BmpImage.description: Describes the basic properties for generating BMP thumbnails from the input video.

width.description: Describes the width of the output video for this layer. The value can be absolute (in pixels) or relative (in percentage). For example 50% means the output video has half as many pixels in width as the input.

height.description: Describes the height of the output video for this layer. The value can be absolute (in pixels) or relative (in percentage). For example 50% means the output video has half as many pixels in height as the input.

label.description: Describes the alphanumeric label for this layer, which can be used in multiplexing different video and audio layers, or in naming the output file.

Layer.description: Describes the basic properties for an output video layer.

BmpLayer.description: This represents a layer in the BmpImage class.

CopyAudio.description: A special codec flag, which tells the encoder to simply copy the input audio bitstream.

values.description: Automatically detect the order of fields
Apply top field first processing of input video.
Apply bottom field first processing of input video.

parity.description: Describes the field parity for de-interlacing, defaults to Auto.

values.description: Disable deinterlacing no matter whether the input is interlaced or not.
Apply automatic pixel adaptive de-interlacing on each frame in the input video.

mode.description: Describes the deinterlacing mode, defaults to AutoPixelAdaptive.

left.description: Describes the number of pixels from the left-margin. This can be absolute pixel value (e.g 100), or relative to the size of the video (e.g: 50%).

top.description: Describes the number of pixels from the top-margin. This can be absolute pixel value (e.g 100), or relative to the size of the video (e.g: 50%).

width.description: Describes the width of the rectangular region in pixels. This can be absolute pixel value (e.g 100), or relative to the size of the video (e.g: 50%).

height.description: Describes the height of the rectangular region in pixels. This can be absolute pixel value (e.g 100), or relative to the size of the video (e.g: 50%).

Rectangle.description: Describes the properties of a rectangular window applied to the input media before processing it.

values.description: Automatically detect and rotate as needed.
Do not rotate and keep the metadata intact.
Rotate zero degrees.
Rotate 90 degrees.
Rotate 180 degrees.
Rotate 270 degrees.

rotation.description: Describes the rotation, if any, to be applied to the input video, before it is encoded.

crop.description: Describes the parameters for the rectangular window with which to crop the input video.

overlays.description: Describes the properties of overlays to be applied to the input video. These could be audio, image or video overlays.

Filters.description: Describes all the filtering operations that are to be applied to the input video before encoding.

bitrate.description: Describes the average bitrate (in bits per second) at which to encode the input video when generating this layer. This is a required field.

maxBitrate.description: Describes the maximum bitrate (in bits per second), at which the VBV buffer should be assumed to refill. If not specified, defaults to the same value as bitrate.

bFrames.description: Describes the number of B-frames to be used when encoding this layer. If not specified, the encoder chooses an appropriate number based on the video Profile and Level.

frameRate.description: Describes the frame rate (in frames per second) at which to encode this layer. The value can be in the form of M/N where M and N are integers (e.g. 30000/1001), or in the form of a number (e.g. 30, or 29.97). The encoder enforces constraints on allowed frame rates based on the Profile and Level. If it is not specified, the encoder will use the same frame rate as the input video.

slices.description: Describes the number of slices to be used when encoding this layer. If not specified, default is zero, which means that encoder will use a single slice for each frame.

adaptiveBFrame.description: Determines whether or not adaptive B-frames are to be used when encoding this layer. If not specified, the encoder will turn it on whenever the video Profile permits its use.

VideoLayer.description: Describes the settings to be used when encoding the input video into a desired output bitrate layer.

values.description: Tells the encoder to automatically determine the appropriate H264 Profile.
Baseline profile
Main profile
High profile.
High 4:2:2 profile.
High 4:4:4 Predictive profile.

profile.description: Describes which Profile of the H.264 standard should be used when encoding this layer. Default is Auto.

level.description: Describes which Level of the H.264 standard should be used when encoding this layer. The value can be Auto, or a number that matches the H264 Profile. If not specified, the default is Auto, which lets the encoder choose the Level that is appropriate for this layer.

bufferWindow.description: Describes the VBV buffer window length. The value should be in ISO 8601 format. The default is PT5S or 5 seconds.

referenceFrames.description: Describes the number of reference frames to be used when encoding this layer. If not specified, the encoder determines an appropriate number based on the encoder complexity setting.

values.description: CABAC (Context Adaptive Binary Arithmetic Coder) entropy encoding
CAVLC (Context Adaptive Variable Length Coder) entropy encoding

entropyMode.description: Describes the entropy mode to be used for this layer. If not specified, the encoder chooses the mode that is appropriate for the Profile and Level.

H264Layer.description: Describes the settings to be used when encoding the input video into a desired output bitrate layer with the H264 video codec.

sceneChangeDetection.description: Determines whether or not the encoder should insert key frames at scene changes. If not specified, the default is false.

values.description: Tells the encoder to use settings that are optimized for how fast the encoding completes.
Tells the encoder to use settings that achieve a balance between speed and quality.
Tells the encoder to use settings that are optimized for to produce a better quality output, at the expense of a slower encode time.

complexity.description: Tells the encoder how to choose its low-level settings. The default is Balanced.

layers.description: Describes a collection of output H264 layers to be produced by the encoder.

H264Video.description: Describes all the properties for encoding a video with the H264 codec.

layers.description: Describes a collection of output JPEG layers to be produced by the encoder.

JpgImage.description: Describes the properties for producing a series of JPEG images from the input video.

quality.description: Describes the compression quality of the JPEG output. Range is from 0-100 and the default is 70.

JpgLayer.description: Describes the settings to produce a JPEG image from the input video.

trackLabels.description: Describes the list of track labels that would be muxed together to produce the file.

outputFiles.description: Describes a list of output files to produce.  Each entry in the list is a set of labels to be muxed together .

MultiBitrateFormat.description: Describes the properties for producing a collection of GOP aligned multi bitrate files.

Mp4Format.description: Describes the properties for an output ISO MP4 file.

layers.description: Describes a collection of output PNG layers to be produced by the encoder.

PngImage.description: This class represents a video encoder which outputs a sequence of Png images.

PngLayer.description: Describes the settings to produce a PNG image from the input video.

values.description: Auto-generate a bitrate ladder (bitrate-resolution pairs) based on the input resolution and bitrate. The auto-generated preset will never exceed the input resolution and bitrate. For example, if the input is 720p at 3 Mbps, output will remain 720p at best, and will start at rates lower than 3 Mbps. The output will will have video and audio in separate files, which is optimal for adaptive streaming.
Produces a single MP4 file containing only stereo audio encoded at 192 kbps.
Produces a set of 8 GOP-aligned MP4 files, ranging from 6000 kbps to 400 kbps, and stereo AAC audio. Resolution starts at 1080p and goes down to 360p.
Produces a set of 6 GOP-aligned MP4 files, ranging from 3400 kbps to 400 kbps, and stereo AAC audio. Resolution starts at 720p and goes down to 360p.
Produces a set of 5 GOP-aligned MP4 files, ranging from 1600kbps to 400 kbps, and stereo AAC audio. Resolution starts at 480p and goes down to 360p.

presetName.description: Describes the built-in prese to be used for encoding videos.

BuiltInStandardEncoderPreset.description: Describes a built-in preset for encoding the input video with the Standard Encoder.

filters.description: Describes the default set of filters to be applied to all the input media (except overlays). Describes operations like rotation, deinterlacing and overlays.

codecs.description: Describes the list of codecs to be used when encoding the input video.

formats.description: Describes the list of outputs to be produced by the encoder.

StandardEncoderPreset.description: Describes all the settings to be used when encoding the input video with the Standard Encoder.

audioInsightsOnly.description: Gets or sets whether to get insights for audio only.

VideoAnalyzerPreset.description: A video analyzer preset that analyzes both audio and video.

TransportStreamFormat.description: Describes the properties for generating an ISO/IEC 13818-1, MPEG-2 Transport Stream output.

position.description: Describes the area in the input video where the overlay is applied.

opacity.description: Describes the opacity of the overlay. This is a value in the range [0 - 1.0]. Default is 1.0

cropRectangle.description: Describes the an optional rectangular window used to crop the overlay image or video.

VideoOverlay.description: Describes the properties of a video overlay.

values.description: Tells the service that if this TransformOutput fails, then any other incomplete TransformOutputs can stopped.
Tells the service that if this TransformOutput fails, then allow any other TransformOutput to continue.

onError.description: Describes what to do if the output fails with the rest of the other outputs. The default is stop the rest of the outputs.

values.description: Used for less time sensitive Jobs.
Normal priority.
Used for Jobs that should take precedence over other Jobs.

relativePriority.description: Sets the relative priority of the TransformOutputs within a Transform. This gives a hint to the system that one TransformOutput is higher priority than another in the same Transform. The default is normal.

preset.description: Preset that describes the Media Processor operation that will be used to generate the output.

TransformOutput.description: Describes an Output from the Transform

created.description: The date and time when the Transform was created.

description.description: Customer supplied description of the transform.

lastModified.description: The date and time when the Transform was last updated.

AvailablePresets.description: The response message for available presets.

Transform.description: A Media Transform that can be applied to an input by creating Jobs.

label.description: Customer provided label of the JobInput.

JobInput.description: Base class for inputs to a Job.

files.description: List of files.  Required for JobInputAzureBlob. It optionally can be used for JobInputAsset to tell the service to only use the files specified from the Asset.

JobInputClip.description: Represents Job Inputs that can have a start or end time specified to take a subset of the specified media.

JobInputs.description: Supports list of inputs to a Job.

JobInputAsset.description: Represents an Asset for input into a Job.

baseUri.description: Base uri for http job input. It will be concatenated with provided file names.   If no base uri is given, then the provided file list is assumed to be fully qualified uris.

error.description: If the JobOutput is in the error state, it contains the details of the error.

values.description: The job was canceled.  This is a final state for the job.
The job is in the process of being canceled.  This is a transient state for the job.
The job has encountered an Error. This is a final state for the job.
The job is finished. This is a final state for the job.
The job is processing.  This is a transient state for the job.
The job is queued. This is a transient state for the job.
The job is scheduled. This is a transient state for the job.

progress.description: If the JobOutput is in the processing state, it contains the percentage of the job completed from 0 to 100 percent.

JobOutput.description: Base class for the output of a Job.

values.description: Fatal service error, please contact support.
Transient error, please retry, if retry is unsuccessful, please contact support.
While trying to download the input files, the files were not accessible, please check the availability of the source.
While trying to download the input files, there was an issue during transfer (storage service, network errors), see details and check your source.
While trying to upload the output files, the destination was not reachable, please should check the availability of the destination.
While trying to upload the output files, there was an issue during transfer (storage service, network errors), see details and check your destination.
There was a problem with input files and the configuration combination, fix the configuration and retry with the same input, or change input to match the configuration.
There was a problem with the input content (i.e. zero byte files, or corrupt/non-decodable files), check the input files.
There was a problem with the format of the input (not valid media file, or an unsupported file/codec), check the validity of the input files.

message.description: A human-readable language-dependent representation of the error.

values.description: The error is service related.
The error is download related.
The error is upload related.
The error is configuration related.
The error is related to data in the input files.

category.description: Category to help caller categorize the error.

values.description: Issue needs to be investigated and then the job resubmitted with corrections or retried once the underlying issue has been corrected.
Issue maybe resolved with wait and resubmit the same Job without further changes.

retry.description: Indication that the job may be retried. If retry is unsuccessful, please contact support.

details.description: An array of details about specific errors that led to this reported error.

assetName.description: The name of the output Asset.

JobOutputAsset.description: Represents an Asset used as a JobOutput.

message.description: A human-readable representation of the error.

created.description: The date and time when the Job was created.

values.description: The job was canceled.  This is a final state for the job.
The job is in the process of being canceled.  This is a transient state for the job.
The job has encountered an Error. This is a final state for the job.
The job is finished. This is a final state for the job.
The job is processing.  This is a transient state for the job.
The job is queued. This is a transient state for the job.
The job is scheduled. This is a transient state for the job.

state.description: The current state of the job.

description.description: The customer supplied description of the Job.

lastModified.description: The date and time when the Job was last updated.

values.description: Used for less time sensitive Jobs.
Normal priority.
Used for Jobs that should take precedence over other Jobs.

priority.description: Priority with which the job should be processed.  Higher priority jobs are processed before lower priority jobs if there is resource contention. If not set, the default is normal.

target.description: The target of the error (for example, the name of the property in error).

@odata.nextLink.description: A link to the next page of the collection (when the collection contains too many results to return in one response).
A link to the next page of the collection (when the collection contains too many results to return in one response).

get.description: Lists the Transforms in the account.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Restricts the set of items returned.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Specifies a non-negative integer n that limits the number of items returned from a collection. The service returns the number of available items up to but not greater than the specified value n.

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: Specifies a non-negative integer n that excludes the first n items of the queried collection from the result. The service returns items starting at position n+1.

put.description: Creates or updates a new Transform.

get.description: Lists all of the Jobs for the Transform.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Restricts the set of items returned.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Specifies a non-negative integer n that limits the number of items returned from a collection. The service returns the number of available items up to but not greater than the specified value n.

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: Specifies a non-negative integer n that excludes the first n items of the queried collection from the result. The service returns items starting at position n+1.

SubscriptionId.name: subscriptionId
SubscriptionId.description: The unique identifier for a Microsoft Azure subscription.

ResourceGroupName.name: resourceGroupName
ResourceGroupName.description: The name of the resource group within the Azure subscription.

ApiVersion.name: api-version
ApiVersion.description: The Version of the API to be used with the client request.
